definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: He loves human being but he never marries or has any children.
sentences.chinese: 他热爱人类，却从未受过拥有妻室与子女的天伦之乐。

sentences.english: He's married but he has a girl-friend on the side.
sentences.chinese: 他虽有妻室，但暗地里还有一个女朋友。

sentences.english: Tom is happy in his wife and children.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆为有妻室儿女而感到幸福。

sentences.english: Gold, you whether is willing to marry this woman is the wife, grows old together?
sentences.chinese: 金，你是否愿娶此女人为妻室，白头偕老？

sentences.english: Like Besso, he is married, but he hardly goes anywhere with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 和贝索一样，他也有妻室，却很少带老婆去哪儿。

sentences.english: Permitted to you, on the night of the fasts, is the approach to your wives.
sentences.chinese: 斋戒的夜间，准你们和妻室交接。

sentences.english: And they abode there, they and their children, and their wives, and their cattle: because afflictions increased upon them.
sentences.chinese: 将子女妻室牲畜也一同带了去，因为大难已临头上。

sentences.english: Like charges to stick, chicken, and did not take wives, all hit others physique.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢刺枪使棒，身强力壮，不取妻室，终日打熬筋骨。

sentences.english: It developed that he had another wife living and his indictment for bigamy followed.
sentences.chinese: 他另有妻室一事已经暴露，随之他被指控犯有重婚罪。

sentences.english: He that hath wife and children hath given hostages to fortune.
sentences.chinese: 有妻室子女的人已将自己押给了命运。

sentences.english: He had a wife and two fine sons.
sentences.chinese: 他有了妻室和两个健壮的儿子。

definition: wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
